title: Great article about why the blame game is holding you back
body:
While this is about Dota 2 specifically the lessons translate very well.

http://www.pcgamer.com/why-playing-the-blame-game-will-always-hold-you-back/


> If some of the blame rests with you, if your play is not perfect, then there is something you can change. You actually have power, in this scenario, because while it is very easy to complain about other players it is very hard to make them play differently. However, it is easier than you think to make you play differently. When you die because you wandered into the enemy jungle with no vision, who is at fault? The support who spent their last 75 gold warding somewhere else, or you for going in anyway? Hint: it's your fault as much theirs, they're not a robot, their nationality has no bearing on their ability, and the only useful thing you can do in that scenario is learn from your mistake.

replies.body:
inb4 the bronzies still come in here and bitch that it's not their fault.

EDIT: And it's funny cause i was right, and this has just turned into a bronzie circle jerk over how they really aren't bad and it's really their team's fault.

Boards are so fucking great.
People can be good on their own and still be stuck in bronze. It's a team game, if your team is crap, you can get held back.

>If some of the blame rests with you, if your play is not perfect, then there is something you can change.

quit blaming everyone else and get good.

It's true though, you can't stop your team from trolling or feeding, better yet you can't control your teammates at all. You really just have to focus on yourself. Why do you think they put 5 champions on one team, and 5 on the other? Because it's a team game. In teamfights you literally have to rely on your team to help you... to some degree you are able to blame them, given they've fed or have trolled, but there's always room to improve yourself.

So question, how is it that anyone has climbed out of bronze?

You want to argue that you can't do anything about trolls, but if that were the case everyone would be in bronze.

Fact is people are less likely to feed if you get them fed, and feeders don't matter as much if you get the right people fed (eg. feeding a yasuo and letting a Malphite feed is fine, because malph is utility well yas is your damage.)

By hard carrying. Which is much harder at higher ranks because everyone isn't a monkey with a keyboard.

It's the ranked system just being fucking shit for this game. You feel zero improvement if you don't roll dice and don't go on a massive winning streak. 

There's no one that inherently and truly enjoys playing ranked, because the system blames _you_ for your teammates faults. Those faults are easier to fix at Bronze than they are for something much higher. You're either above your tier and can carry hard, or you're above your division and you cannot do anything.

The worst part is Riot hides your MMR/ELO and covers it LP which is just garbage.

But you can't do anything about trolls? All you can do is report and ignore them, it's not as if you could control their character. And no, not everyone would be in bronze, because quite a few people actually want to do well in ranked, meaning they'd work together, like a team should.

There's only so much you can carry in a game. If your team is feeding, or just not very good and losing lanes, i'm sorry but even if I have 10 kills by 10 minutes, I can't fight a 1v5.

And it's worse when you're playing against a team that CAN co-ordinate, and your team bumbles around chasing kills. I consider myself a silver player, but while somebody who's good enough to be in challenger can climb out of bronze with ease, it's not that easy for those who aren't that good. I try to co-ordinate teams, take objectives and try to make the best plays I can, but none of this helps if i'm basically playing a 1v5.

Sorry but i can look at your stats and tell you your not a silver player.

negative K/D on your top 6 champions.

poor farm on all your champs.

mostly negative win rates.

And no don't give me all this "people were feeding" horse shit.

Earlier this week i went 5/1/4 as shaco jungle with a rage quit Tristana and a 1/11 karma support (yes it's a normal but it's still accurate, not to mention we probably could have carried if we felt like it, but it would have been a chore for a normal.)
Love to know where you're getting your stats from. I use LoLDB and yeah, I have bad winrates inside of ranked, but good winrates in normals.
In fact, according to LoLDB, I have above 50% winrates in S5 on 4 of my top6 champ picks.

I think this part sums up what you are saying pretty well. I am **definitely** not saying its ALL one players fault. BUT as long as there were mistakes made by you its a good thing. It means you have the power to improve and make more impact the next time a similar situation arises.

"If every loss is somebody else's fault and you are playing flawlessly, you are the unluckiest human being in the world. You have broken mathematics. There is nothing you can do, and you should certainly never play any game that involves rolling a dice. If this is true, for you—like really, I-can-prove-it true—then you're screwed, aren't you? You are so unlucky that there is no point in trying to get better.

If some of the blame rests with you, if your play is not perfect, then there is something you can change. You actually have power, in this scenario, because while it is very easy to complain about other players it is very hard to make them play differently. However, it is easier than you think to make you play differently. When you die because you wandered into the enemy jungle with no vision, who is at fault? The support who spent their last 75 gold warding somewhere else, or you for going in anway? Hint: it's your fault as much theirs, they're not a robot, their nationality has no bearing on their ability, and the only useful thing you can do in that scenario is learn from your mistake."

Also interesting thing I read on [Reddit today](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/3mci3p/players_cant_carry_anymore/) - "I would just like to point out that Rush, during his climb up to Challenger in Korea, had a 97% win rate. If you don't think that guy was carrying all those games, I don't know what to say."
Of course everyone's going to be like Rush and Faker and just carry the game!
BUT SUPPORT SONA IS BUILDING FULL AP!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
THE SUPPORT TAHM IS BUILDING AD!!!!!!!!!

Dont make me go AP Draven, none of my skills scales with AP but why not.

The mere fact that boosting is a thing is evidence that people can get stuck.  If a single player can boost another by carrying the game, it stands to reason that a single player can hold others back by sucking. The nature of the climb means that 4 unlucky games can undo the hard work of 2 weeks climb. It is frustratingly punishing. 

  Bronze is like snakes and ladders. Duo increases chances there is no denying.  But in yolo q there are a lot more snakes than ladders.
